channel.title: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
channel.description: The Moscow Times offers everything you need to know about Russia: Breaking news, top stories, business, analysis, opinion, multimedia, upcoming cultural events

item.title: All 28 Bodies Found From Far East Russia Plane Crash
item.description: The An-26 disappeared en route from the Kamchatka peninsula’s main city to the coast.

item.title: Russians Sour on Navalny After ‘Extremist’ Ruling – Poll
item.description: The ruling and a new law banning “extremists” from running for parliament has effectively dismantled Russia’s most potent opposition force.

item.title: Russia Says Taliban Controls Two-Thirds of Afghan-Tajik Border
item.description: Russia said it is ready to take "additional measures" to "prevent aggression" on its ally Tajikistan but urged all sides to "show restraint."

item.title: A Royal Mark Up: How an Emirati Sheikh Resells Millions of Russian Vaccines to the Developing World
item.description: The Moscow Times investigated a deal between Russia and a minor Dubai royal to supply poor countries with Sputnik V — at high prices.

item.title: Coronavirus in Russia: The Latest News | July 9
item.description: Record-setting deaths. Moscow cases soar. Mandatory vaccination.

item.title: Russia Proposes Six-Month Extension of Syria Cross-Border Aid: UN Sources
item.description: Russia has proposed a draft resolution to its 14 UN Security Council partners calling for a six-month extension of the authorization of cross-border aid to Syria.

item.title: Putin Overturns 2015 Ban on Flights to Egyptian Resorts
item.description: Russia had banned flights to Egypt in 2015 after a bomb brought down a Russian plane over the Sinai Peninsula.

item.title: EU Invites Russia to Discuss Mutual Vaccine Certificate Recognition – TASS
item.description: The EU has approached Russia regarding possible mutual recognition of vaccine certificates, EU Ambassador Markus Ederer said Thursday.

item.title: Belarus Raids Independent News Sites in Media Crackdown
item.description: President Lukashenko's regime continues to clamp down on media not under state control in the wake of last year's opposition protests.

item.title: Russian Football Head Coach Sacked After Lackluster Euro 2020 Showing
item.description: The team's embarrassing first-round exit had prompted calls for top-down reforms in Russian football.

item.title: Russia Faces Huge Revenue Losses From Renewables Push, Finance Minister Warns
item.description: Russia is the world’s top energy exporter and its economy is heavily dependent on oil and gas.

item.title: Russian Doctors Battle Virus and Heat in Hospital 'Red Zone'
item.description: While Russia recorded its highest temperatures in more than a century in late June, hospital staff worked for hours in full protective gear.

item.title: Tajikistan Seeks Russia-Led Alliance’s Aid as Violence Builds on Afghan Border
item.description: The security situation along the remote, mountainous Afghan-Tajik border has deteriorated in recent weeks as U.S. forces quit the region.

item.title: Russian Health Worker Detained for Selling Fake Covid Vaccine Certificates – Police
item.description: The detained suspect said she had poured out vaccine doses and falsified medical records for around 15 customers.

item.title: Russian Court Bans ‘Happy Tree Friends,’ Anime Films
item.description: The adult cartoon “harms young children’s spiritual and moral education and development,” the court said.

item.title: Floods Kill 8 in Southern Russia Resorts
item.description: Some areas of the Krasnodar region saw more than two months' worth of rainfall in mere hours.

item.title: Russia Expels Estonian Consul Over Alleged Espionage
item.description: The FSB security service said it had detained consul Mart Latte while he was receiving classified documents from a Russian national.

item.title: Famous Faces Join the Race in Russia's High-Stakes Parliamentary Elections
item.description: Well-known figures from Russian entertainment, media and sports are seeking a spot on the ballot.

item.title: 19 Bodies Found From Plane Crash in Far Eastern Russia
item.description: A passenger plane with 28 people on board crashed Tuesday in Russia's remote Kamchatka peninsula.

item.title: U.S. RNC Breach Traced to Russia-Linked Hacking Group – Bloomberg
item.description: The Kremlin denied the reports of Moscow's involvement in the hack.

item.title: Russia Says Ready to Activate Tajik Military Base Amid U.S. Pullout, Taliban Advance in Afghanistan
item.description: “We’ll do everything ... to prevent any aggressive encroachments against our allies,” Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said.

item.title: U.S. Software Firm Moves to Restart After Huge Ransomware Attack Linked to Russia-Based Group
item.description: The White House reiterated the warning President Joe Biden gave to his counterpart Vladimir Putin about Russia harboring cybercriminals.

item.title: American Lawyer Detained in Russia Alongside Veteran Belarus Opposition Leader – CNN
item.description: Russian FSB agents reportedly put a hood over Yuras Zyankovich’s head and took him to Belarus to face charges of attempting a coup.

item.title: Estonian Consul Held in Russia Over 'Classified Documents'
item.description: Estonia's consul in St. Petersburg was "caught red-handed" said the FSB.

item.title: Passenger Plane Wreckage Found in Eastern Russia, 28 Feared Dead
item.description: Search and rescue efforts were paused after night fell and news agencies quoted local sources as saying it appeared that all passengers and crew had died.

item.title: Russia's Yandex to Launch Delivery Robots in U.S.
item.description: Yandex said it would partner with U.S. delivery giant Grubhub to deploy the self-driving rovers at 250 college campuses across the United States.

item.title: Russian Military Delegation Secretly Visited Myanmar Ahead of Junta Leader’s Moscow Visit – Reports
item.description: A 20-member Russian delegation led by two Navy officers reportedly visited Myanmar’s capital and its commercial center last month.

item.title: Belarus Strongman Threatens Ban on German Export Traffic to Russia, China
item.description: The Kremlin called Lukashenko’s threats the result of “harsh, unjustified and illegal” sanctions.

item.title: ‘We Are Not Revolutionaries’: Russia’s Last Liberal Party Operates Under No Illusions
item.description: Yabloko stalwarts see little chance of victory in September’s high-stakes elections to the country’s national parliament.

item.title: Russia Sets New Covid-19 Death Record
item.description: Tuesday's pandemic record of 737 deaths is a 13% jump from the old record of 697 set just days earlier.

item.title: Russian Doctors Refusing to Vaccinate People Living With HIV – NGO
item.description: Health experts told RBC that HIV is not a contraindication to Covid-19 vaccines.

item.title: Russia’s Blacklisting of Bard College Signals End of Key U.S.-Russia Cultural Exchange
item.description: The U.S. liberal arts college has been labeled “undesirable,” effectively banning its dual-degree program with St. Petersburg State University.

item.title: Top Belarus Opposition Figure Babaryko Jailed for 14 Years
item.description: Viktor Babaryko was arrested last year ahead of a disputed presidential election that sparked nationwide demonstrations.

item.title: Siberia Forest Fires Fueled by Historic Drought, Heatwave
item.description: More than 250 fires covering 607,000 hectares of land are currently burning across the republic of Sakha, Russia's largest region.

item.title: Georgia LGBTQ Activists Cancel Pride March After Clashes
item.description: Organizers accused the prime minister of encouraging homophobic sentiments and his government of failing to "protect fundamental human rights."

item.title: French Champagne Houses Cry Foul Over Russian Label Rule
item.description: President Vladimir Putin signed a law that will forbid the use of the Russian translation of champagne on imported bottles.

item.title: Vaccinate or Repent Forever, Russian Orthodox Church Warns
item.description: An independent poll released Monday said 54% of Russians are still unwilling to get vaccinated against Covid-19.

item.title: Russian Warships to Reinforce Black Sea Forces Amid U.S.-Led Drills
item.description: The vessels will join forces activated for training checks against the backdrop of NATO’s Sea Breeze drills.

item.title: Majority of Russians Still Not Ready for Covid-19 Vaccination – Poll
item.description: The Levada Center also said 58% of Russians do not support the policy of compulsory vaccination that's being ordered by a growing number of regions.

item.title: Oscar-Winning Director Vladimir Menshov Dies at Age 82
item.description: The Soviet director and actor passed away on Sunday at age 82 from coronavirus.

item.title: Russia Says Its Forests Neutralize Billions of Tons of Greenhouse Gases. Scientists Have Their Doubts.
item.description: Eight experts told The Moscow Times the government headline figure of 2.5 billion metric tons of CO2 is at best unproven and at worst unrealistic.

item.title: Russian Food Retailer VkusVill Apologizes for ‘Hurtful’ LGBT Family Ad
item.description: Members of Russia's LGBT community slammed the apology.

item.title: Khodorkovsky Says Ready to Relocate His Russia-Based Journalists Facing ‘Next Purge’
item.description: He made the announcement after Russia added four of his civil society and educational groups to its list of “undesirable” organizations.

item.title: News From Russia: What You Missed Over the Weekend
item.description: Delta spread. Champagne suspension. LGBT ad apology.

item.title: Russia Posts Highest Number of Virus Cases Since Early January
item.description: Russia on Sunday announced 25,142 new infections, the highest figure since January 2 when Russia was emerging from a second wave of the pandemic.

item.title: Russian Law Takes Fizz Out of French Champagne Supplies
item.description: Russian elites could soon find themselves without their favorite French bubbles if Moet Hennessy makes good on a threat to halt champagne supplies following a new law signed by President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Former French PM Fillon Joins Russian Oil Company Board
item.description: Former French prime minister Francois Fillon has been named to the board of Russian state oil company Zarubezhneft, a list published by a website specialising in business information disclosure showed.

item.title: Russia Reports Record Covid Deaths for Fifth Straight Day
item.description: Russia is battling the surging Delta variant.

item.title: Arctic Ocean’s ‘Last Ice Area’ Disappearing Faster Than Expected – Study
item.description: The oldest, thickest Arctic sea ice known as the “Last Ice Area” is melting faster than anticipated as the earth warms, scientists wrote.

item.title: Russian Governors’ Approvals Drop as Kremlin Distances From Virus Response – Poll
item.description: Russia's regions have been tasked with taking unpopular measures like mandatory vaccinations during the latest Covid-19 surge.
